1.verse: Paul, Silvanus, and Timothy, to the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:

2.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

3.verse: We ought always to thank God for you, brothers, as is fitting, because your faith is growing abundantly, and the love of each one of you for one another is increasing,

4.verse: so that we ourselves boast about you in the churches of God for your patience and faith in all the persecutions and afflictions that you are enduring.

5.verse: This is evidence of the righteous judgment of God, and results in your being considered worthy of the kingdom of God, for which you are indeed suffering.

6.verse: For it is a righteous thing for God to repay with affliction those who afflict you,

7.verse: and to give relief to you who are afflicted, and to us as well, when the Lord Jesus is revealed from heaven with his mighty angels

8.verse: in flaming fire, inflicting punishment on those who do not know God, and who do not obey the gospel of our Lord Jesus.

9.verse: They will experience the punishment of eternal destruction, away from the presence of the Lord and from the glory of his power

10.verse: on that day when he comes to be glorified in his saints, and to be marveled at by all who have believed, because our testimony to you was believed.

11.verse: With this in view we pray for you constantly, that our God will count you worthy of his calling, and by his power bring to fulfillment every good resolve and work of faith,

12.verse: so that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you, and you in him, according to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.

1.verse: Now concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our assembling to him, we ask you, brothers,

2.verse: not to be quickly shaken out of your wits or disturbed, either by a prophecy or by a spoken word or by a letter purporting to come from us, to the effect that the day of the Lord is already here.

3.verse: Let no one deceive you in any way; for that day will not come unless the rebellion comes first and the man of lawlessness is revealed, the son of destruction,

4.verse: who opposes and exalts himself above every so-called god or object of worship, so that he takes his seat in the temple of God, proclaiming that he himself is God.

5.verse: Do you not remember that I told you this while I was still with you?

6.verse: And now you know what is holding him in check, so that he may be revealed at his proper time.

7.verse: For the mystery of lawlessness is already at work; however, the one who is now restraining will continue to do so until he is taken away.

8.verse: And then the lawless one will be revealed, whom the Lord Jesus will destroy with the breath of his mouth, and bring to an end with the splendor of his coming.

9.verse: The coming of the lawless one will be according to the activity of Satan, with all kinds of false miracles, signs, and wonders,

10.verse: and with every kind of wicked deception for those who are perishing, because they did not accept the love of the truth so as to be saved.

11.verse: For this reason God will send them an active delusion leading them to believe the lie,

12.verse: that they all may be condemned who did not believe the truth but took pleasure in unrighteousness.

13.verse: But we ought always to thank God for you, brothers loved by the Lord, because God chose you as first fruits for salvation, by sanctification of the Spirit and belief in the truth.

14.verse: And he called you to this salvation through our gospel, that you might come to share the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.

15.verse: So then, brothers, stand firm and hold to the traditions that you were taught, either by what we said or what we wrote.

16.verse: Now may our Lord Jesus Christ himself and God our Father, who has loved us and given us eternal encouragement and good hope by grace,

17.verse: encourage your hearts and establish you in every good work and word.

1.verse: Finally, brothers, pray for us, that the word of the Lord may spread rapidly and be honored, as in fact it was among you.

2.verse: Pray also that we may be delivered from unprincipled and wicked men; for not all belong to the faith.

3.verse: But the Lord is faithful; he will establish you and guard you from the evil one.

4.verse: And we are confident in the Lord regarding you, that you are doing and will continue to do the things we require of you.

5.verse: Now may the Lord direct your hearts into the love of God and into the endurance of Christ.

6.verse: But we charge you, brothers, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, to stay away from any brother who conducts himself in a disorderly manner and not according to the tradition that they received from us.

7.verse: For you yourselves know how our example should be followed, because we did not lead disorderly lives among you,

8.verse: nor did we eat anyone’s food without paying for it. Instead we kept working night and day with toil and hardship, so we would not be a burden to any of you,

9.verse: not because we do not have the right, but in order to make ourselves an example for you to imitate.

10.verse: For even when we were with you, we gave you this charge: “If anyone is not willing to work, then he should not eat.”

11.verse: For we hear that some among you are conducting themselves in a disorderly manner, doing nothing themselves, but meddling in the affairs of others.

12.verse: Such people we charge and exhort in the Lord Jesus Christ that they work quietly and eat their own food.

13.verse: But you, brothers, must not become discouraged in doing what is right.

14.verse: Now if anyone does not obey what we say in this letter, take note of that person and do not associate with him, so that he will feel ashamed.

15.verse: Do not regard him as an enemy, but admonish him as a brother.

16.verse: Now may the Lord of peace himself give you peace always in every circumstance. The Lord be with you all.

17.verse: The greeting is with my own hand—Paul’s—which is a mark of genuineness in every letter; so I write.

18.verse: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all.
